decks.notes: The main concept of the deck is to use aggressive creatures like Delver of Secrets and Tarmogoyf to quickly apply pressure to the opponent while disrupting their game plan with cards like Daze, Force of Will, and Abrupt Decay. The deck also includes powerful card draw and selection spells like Brainstorm and Ponder to help find key pieces and maintain tempo. The mana base is designed to support the three-color requirements of the deck, with efficient lands like Wasteland and fetch lands like Polluted Delta and Scalding Tarn.

The main focus of this Legacy Aggro-Burn deck is to quickly and aggressively deal damage to the opponent using efficient burn spells like Lightning Bolt, Price of Progress, and Lava Spike. The deck also includes creatures like Goblin Guide, Monastery Swiftspear, and Eidolon of the Great Revel to apply pressure and further increase the damage output. Overall, the deck aims to race the opponent and win the game as fast as possible by utilizing a combination of burn spells and aggressive creatures.

The main concept of this deck is to generate a high amount of mana quickly through cards like Grim Monolith and Metalworker, allowing for powerful artifact creatures like Lodestone Golem and Wurmcoil Engine to be played early. Chalice of the Void and Trinisphere disrupt opponents' game plans, while cards like Platinum Emperion and Ugin, the Spirit Dragon provide additional threats. The deck aims to overpower opponents with its aggressive artifact creatures and lock down the game with disruptive spells, making it a formidable Aggro-MUD archetype in Legacy 1 vs 1 matches.

The main idea of this deck is to control the board with early disruption spells like Force of Will and Thoughtseize, while also utilizing efficient removal like Abrupt Decay and Hymn to Tourach. The deck aims to gain card advantage with cards like Ancestral Vision and Shardless Agent, and close out the game with powerful threats like Tarmogoyf and Shardless Agent. This deck also includes versatile planeswalkers like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Liliana of the Veil to help further control the game and outvalue the opponent.

This deck focuses on aggressive play with a mix of powerful creatures and disruption spells. The key concept is to use the powerful creatures like Tarmogoyf and Bloodbraid Elf to quickly put pressure on the opponent's life total, while also using disruptive spells like Hymn to Tourach and Thoughtseize to disrupt their game plan. The deck also has a strong removal suite with cards like Abrupt Decay and Lightning Bolt to deal with opposing threats. Additionally, the inclusion of Punishing Fire and Grove of the Burnwillows provides a recurring source of damage.

The key concept of this deck is to control the game through countering spells, manipulating the top of the library, and efficiently removing threats while setting up powerful win conditions. The deck aims to maintain a strong board presence and card advantage through counterspells like Force of Will, Counterbalance, and Counterspell, while also using cards like Brainstorm, Predict, and Sensei's Divining Top to set up Terminus and Entreat the Angels for board wipes or big creature plays. The deck also includes versatile creatures like Vendilion Clique and Snapcaster Mage to handle various threats.

The deck focuses on controlling the game through counter spells, board wipes, and removal. It aims to stabilize the board with cards like Terminus and Swords to Plowshares, while maintaining card advantage and controlling the opponent's plays with Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Counterbalance. The deck is able to dig for answers and manipulate the top of the library with cards like Brainstorm and Sensei's Divining Top. Entreat the Angels serves as a win condition, providing a powerful threat to close out the game once control is established.

This deck focuses on a fast and explosive combo using Elf creatures to generate mana, draw cards, and eventually tutor for powerful threats like Craterhoof Behemoth. The key strategy is to ramp up quickly with cards like Gaea's Cradle and Heritage Druid, then utilize Glimpse of Nature to chain together draws and plays to overwhelm the opponent. With the ability to fetch key creatures with Green Sun's Zenith and Natural Order, the deck can quickly assemble its combo pieces and close out games in a single turn.

The deck is designed to quickly apply pressure on the opponent by playing efficient threats like Delver of Secrets, Nimble Mongoose, and Tarmogoyf while disrupting their game plan with cards like Wasteland, Daze, and Stifle. The deck also has a strong card selection and permission suit with Ponder, Brainstorm, Force of Will, and Spell Pierce. The mana base consists of various fetchlands and dual lands to ensure consistency in casting spells. The deck aims to control the game tempo and finish off the opponent before they can stabilize.

The main concept of this deck is to utilize cheap and efficient creatures like Delver of Secrets and Tarmogoyf to apply pressure on the opponent while disrupting their game plan with cards like Daze, Force of Will, and Wasteland. The deck aims to control the game through counter spells and removal (Abrupt Decay, Lightning Bolt) while also generating card advantage with cards like Brainstorm and Sylvan Library. The inclusion of disruptive creatures like Deathrite Shaman and disruptive spells like Spell Pierce and Stifle further adds to the overall strategy of overwhelming the opponent with aggression and disruption.

The main concept of this deck is to utilize the Aluren combo to play creatures for free and generate card advantage. By casting Aluren and then playing creatures with a converted mana cost of three or less, this deck can continuously loop creatures onto the battlefield to control the game and overwhelm the opponent. The deck uses disruptive cards like Thoughtseize and Cabal Therapy to disrupt the opponent's strategy while generating value with cards like Baleful Strix and Shardless Agent. The deck aims to create a powerful board presence and win the game through attrition and card advantage.

The deck focuses on utilizing a strong suite of counterspells, card draw, and board control elements to disrupt and control the opponent's game plan. By using cards like Counterbalance and Sensei's Divining Top to counter spells and manipulate the top of the library, along with removal spells like Swords to Plowshares and Terminus, the deck aims to answer threats efficiently. Additionally, the deck can generate card advantage and extra value with cards like Snapcaster Mage and Jace, the Mind Sculptor, while also having a win condition in Entreat the Angels.

This deck focuses on using efficient creatures and disruptive spells to quickly pressure the opponent and control the board. By utilizing mana acceleration, versatile hate cards, and powerful equipment, it aims to deploy threats early and protect them while also disrupting the opponent's game plan. The synergy between the creatures and spells creates a proactive and resilient strategy that can adapt to different matchups. The deck's strength lies in its ability to apply constant pressure while limiting the opponent's options through disruption and efficient removal, ultimately overwhelming them with a consistent and versatile game plan.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly assemble the Dark Depths combo, which consists of using Thespian's Stage to copy Dark Depths and create a 20/20 Marit Lage token. The deck includes cards like Crop Rotation, Sylvan Scrying, and Expedition Map to find the necessary combo pieces, as well as protection cards like Pithing Needle and Not of This World to counter any potential threats. Thoughtseize, Inquisition of Kozilek, and Duress help to disrupt the opponent's game plan while cards like Lotus Petal and Elvish Spirit Guide provide fast mana acceleration.

This deck focuses on using a combination of powerful control elements such as counter spells, board wipes, and card advantage to dominate the game. It aims to win through a combination of controlling the board state with cards like Terminus and Swords to Plowshares while also generating value with cards like Snapcaster Mage and Jace, the Mind Sculptor. The deck utilizes the Counterbalance and Sensei's Divining Top combo for additional control and card advantage, allowing the player to dictate the flow of the game and come out on top in the end.

The main concept of this UWx Control deck is to effectively control the game using a combination of counter spells, card draw, and creature removal. The deck aims to stabilize the board with cards like Terminus and Swords to Plowshares, while using Counterbalance and Sensei's Divining Top to control what spells opponents can resolve. By generating card advantage with Snapcaster Mage and Jace, the Mind Sculptor, the deck can win the game through card advantage and efficient removal spells, eventually closing out the game with a powerful threat like Batterskull or Entreat the Angels.
